title: Slipped
effect: You must make a successful DC 10 DEX Save or immediately fall prone.

title: Pulled up lame
effect: You must make a successful DC 10 CON save or your speed is halved until the encounter ends..

title: Something in your eye
effect: Your melee and ranged attacks only do half damage for the remainder of the encounter.

title: Whiplashed
effect: Your weapon kicks back,  striking you slightly and you take 1d8 damage.

title: Wind knocked out of you
effect: You become exhausted to level 1 of that condition.

title: Loss of confidence
effect: You gain disadvantage for your attacks against this opponent for the remainder of the encounter.

title: Shook yourself up
effect: You are stunned for 1 rd.

title: Give them hope
effect: Your target’s allies within 30 feet gain a d6 inspiration die that can be used during this encounter.

title: Panic attack
effect: You must make a successful DC 10 WIS Save or become frightened for the remainder of the encounter.

title: Dropped weapon
effect: Your drop your weapon and it falls 10’ from your location in a random direction.

title: Discombobulated
effect: You become incapacitated for 1 rd.

title: You’ve fallen and you can’t get up
effect: You immediately fall prone and lose all movement this round.

title: Bad timing
effect: You drop to last in the imitative order for the combat but do not act again this turn.

title: Broken bone
effect: You break a bone in your hand. You suffer disadvantage for the rest of the encounter and take 1d6 damage every rd. until healed.

title: Easy prey
effect: Allies of the target within 20’ will attack you with their next turn,  unless they would suffer an Attack of Opportunity to do so.

title: Exposed defenses
effect: Your attack unbalances you so much that your target may take one attack against you as a reaction.

title: Your own worst enemy
effect: You suffer the effects of a bane spell for the remainder of the encounter.

title: Unguarded
effect: All adjacent allies of your target may immediately take an attack of opportunity against you.

title: Costly mistake
effect: Your target may reroll all 1s and 2s on the damage roll for his next successful attack vs. you.

title: Revealed intentions
effect: You and your allies all suffer disadvantage for your next attack.

title: Wrong target
effect: You mistakenly strike an ally adjacent to you with your attack.

title: Lodged weapon
effect: Your weapon becomes stuck in the floor or a nearby object. You must make a DC 14 STR check to remove it as an action.

title: Devastating error
effect: Your opponent may immediately make one attack with advantage against you as a reaction.

title: Shattered
effect: Your weapon breaks if it is non-magical. Enchanted weapons must make a DC 8 Save and get a +1 to their roll for every + of the weapon.

title: Thrown weapon
effect: You lose your grip and throw your weapon. It lands 30’ from your location in a random direction.

title: Panic attack
effect: You immediately suffer the effects of the Confusion spell for 1 rd.

title: Horrible aftermath
effect: Roll twice on this chart and apply both effects to yourself.

title: Self-inflicted wound
effect: Your attack ricochets back and you hit yourself. Roll your damage as if you had hit your target and apply it to yourself.

title: Did you see that?
effect: Your attack ricochets back and you hit yourself. Apply the maximum damage to yourself as if you had hit your target.

title: No!
effect: Your attack ricochets back and you hit yourself. Apply the maximum critical damage to yourself as if you had hit your target.
